headline: Is DTE’s (DTE) Battery Storage Push Quietly Redefining Its Long-Term Capital Allocation Playbook?
summary: In early February 2026, DTE Energy’s board declared a quarterly dividend of $1.165 per share and advanced a battery energy storage proposal tied to its Fish Creek Solar Park, while a separate criminal case concluded with a prison sentence for threats made against the company’s shareholders and Michigan’s governor. Together with Michigan’s broader decarbonization push, the new storage project highlights how DTE is reshaping its grid and generation mix toward more resilient, cleaner...
